title: Macbook pro 820-01700 T2 Issue no revive or restore
message:
Hello, I have a MacBook pro motherboard that is not turning on, this had the battery previously replaced.
I have tried the following:
Plugged in the charger is showing 5v 0.03amps when I go into the dfu mode is showing 20v 0.03 to 0.07, sometimes goes to 0.38amp.
After I try to revive it, is not show anything on the screen and in Apple configurator is telling me that the apple configurator is not booted. Same if I try to restore.

Any help would be great.
Thanks

title: Macbook pro 820-01700 T2 Issue no revive or restore
message:
Be sure to use original 96W charger; with corresponding 100W certified cable.

Do you get all G3S and SSD voltages?

title: Macbook pro 820-01700 T2 Issue no revive or restore
message:
Hello, I actually have 87W charger, I will try today with 96W as well and reply back, thanks
The voltages looked ok but I will also double check again.

title: Macbook pro 820-01700 T2 Issue no revive or restore
message: Hi’.it is as 2informaticos says very important to use the right charger. I do not have much hair but almost lost the rest of it because of a similar issue as yours. After hours and hours I was told to try another charger (96 watt) and boom👌…. Problem solved (to be honest I still forget it)… Thank you 2informaticos🙏
